name: ibm-iam
label: IBM IAM
description: The IBM IAM Identity Service API is used to manage service IDs, API key identities, trusted profiles, account security settings and to create IAM access tokens for a user or service ID.

fields.title: Server URL
fields.name: server_url
fields.tooltip: Specify the URL of the IBM IAM server to connect and perform automated operations.
fields.description: Specify the URL of the IBM IAM server to connect and perform automated operations.

fields.title: API key
fields.name: api_key
fields.tooltip: Enter your IBM Cloud API key.
fields.description: Enter your IBM Cloud API key.

fields.title: Verify SSL
fields.name: verify_ssl
fields.description: Specifies whether the SSL certificate for the server is to be verified. By default, this option is set to True.
fields.tooltip: Specifies whether the SSL certificate for the server is to be verified. By default, this option is set to True.

operations.title: Get API Keys By IAM ID & Account ID
operations.description: Returns the list of API key details for a given service or user IAM ID and account ID.

parameters.title: Account ID
parameters.name: account_id
parameters.description: Specify the Account ID of the API keys to query.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the Account ID of the API keys to query.

parameters.title: IAM ID
parameters.name: iam_id
parameters.description: Specify the IAM ID of the API keys to be queried.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the IAM ID of the API keys to be queried.

parameters.title: Page Size
parameters.name: pagesize
parameters.placeholder: eg: Default is 20 items per page.
parameters.description: Optional size of a single page. Default is 20 items per page. Valid range is 1 to 100.
parameters.tooltip: Optional size of a single page. Default is 20 items per page. Valid range is 1 to 100.

parameters.title: Page Token
parameters.name: pagetoken
parameters.placeholder: eg: Default is start with first page.
parameters.description: Optional Prev or Next page token returned from a previous query execution. Default is start with first page.
parameters.tooltip: Optional Prev or Next page token returned from a previous query execution. Default is start with first page.

parameters.title: Scope
parameters.name: scope
parameters.tooltip: Optional parameter to define the scope of the queried API keys. Can be 'entity' (default) or 'account'.
parameters.description: Optional parameter to define the scope of the queried API keys. Can be 'entity' (default) or 'account'.

parameters.title: Type
parameters.name: type_value
parameters.tooltip: Optional parameter to filter the type of the queried API keys. Can be 'user' or 'serviceid'.
parameters.description: Optional parameter to filter the type of the queried API keys. Can be 'user' or 'serviceid'.

parameters.title: Sort
parameters.name: sort
parameters.tooltip: Optional parameter to filter the type of the queried API keys. Can be 'user' or 'serviceid'.
parameters.description: Optional parameter to filter the type of the queried API keys. Can be 'user' or 'serviceid'.

parameters.title: Order
parameters.name: order
parameters.tooltip: Optional sort order, valid values are asc and desc. Default: asc.
parameters.description: Optional sort order, valid values are asc and desc. Default: asc.

parameters.title: Include History
parameters.name: include_history
parameters.tooltip: Defines if the entity history is included in the response.
parameters.description: Defines if the entity history is included in the response.

operations.title: Create An API Key
operations.description: Creates an API key for a UserID or service ID. Users can manage user API keys for themself, or service ID API keys for service IDs they have access to

parameters.title: Account ID
parameters.name: account_id
parameters.description: Specify the account ID of the API key.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the account ID of the API key..

parameters.title: Name
parameters.name: name
parameters.tooltip: Name of the API key.
parameters.description: Specify the name is not checked for uniqueness. Therefore multiple names with the same value can exist. Access is done via the UUID of the API key.

parameters.title: IAM ID
parameters.name: iam_id
parameters.tooltip: Specify  iam_id that this API key authenticates.
parameters.description: Specify the Specify  iam_id that this API key authenticates.

parameters.title: Description
parameters.name: description
parameters.description: Optional description of the API key. The 'description' property is only available if a description was provided during a create of an API key.
parameters.tooltip: Optional description of the API key. The 'description' property is only available if a description was provided during a create of an API key.

operations.title: Get API Key Details By Value
operations.description: Returns the details of an API key by its value.

parameters.title: IAM ApiKey
parameters.name: iam_apiKey
parameters.tooltip: Pass the API key value for this API key.
parameters.description: Pass the API key value for this API key.

parameters.title: Include History
parameters.name: include_history
parameters.description: Defines if the entity history is included in the response Default: false.
parameters.tooltip: Defines if the entity history is included in the response Default: false.

operations.title: Get API Key Details
operations.description: Returns the details of an API key

parameters.title: Api Key Unique ID
parameters.name: api_key_unique_id
parameters.tooltip: Specify the Unique ID of the API key.
parameters.description: Specify the Unique ID of the API key.

parameters.title: Include History
parameters.name: include_history
parameters.description: Defines if the entity history is included in the response Default: false.
parameters.tooltip: Defines if the entity history is included in the response Default: false.

parameters.title: Include Activity
parameters.name: include_activity
parameters.description: Defines if the entity's activity is included in the response. Retrieving activity data is an expensive operation, so only request this when needed Default: false.
parameters.tooltip: Defines if the entity's activity is included in the response. Retrieving activity data is an expensive operation, so only request this when needed  Default: false.

operations.title: Update API Key
operations.description: Creates an API key for a UserID or service ID.

parameters.title: Entity Tag
parameters.name: entity_tag
parameters.tooltip: Specify the version that you retrieved when reading the API key.
parameters.description: Specify the version that you retrieved when reading the API key.

parameters.title: Api Key Unique ID
parameters.name: api_key_unique_id
parameters.tooltip: Specify the Unique ID of the API key.
parameters.description: Specify the Unique ID of the API key.

parameters.title: Name
parameters.name: name
parameters.tooltip: Name of the API key.
parameters.description: Specify the name is not checked for uniqueness. Therefore multiple names with the same value can exist. Access is done via the UUID of the API key.

parameters.title: Description
parameters.name: description
parameters.description: Optional description of the API key. The 'description' property is only available if a description was provided during a create of an API key.
parameters.tooltip: Optional description of the API key. The 'description' property is only available if a description was provided during a create of an API key.

parameters.title: Support Sessions
parameters.name: support_sessions
parameters.tooltip: Define if the API key supports sessions.
parameters.description: Define if the API key supports sessions.

parameters.title: Action When Leaked
parameters.name: action_when_leaked
parameters.tooltip: Select the action to take when API key is leaked, valid values are 'none', 'disable' and 'delete'.
parameters.description: Select the action to take when API key is leaked, valid values are 'none', 'disable' and 'delete'.

operations.title: Delete API Key
operations.description: Deletes an API key.

parameters.title: Api Key Unique ID
parameters.name: api_key_unique_id
parameters.tooltip: Specify the Unique ID of the API key.
parameters.description: Specify the Unique ID of the API key.

operations.title: Lock API Key
operations.description: Lock an API key by ID.

parameters.title: Api Key Unique ID
parameters.name: api_key_unique_id
parameters.tooltip: Specify the Unique ID of the API key.
parameters.description: Specify the Unique ID of the API key.

operations.title: UnLock API Key
operations.description: Un-Lock an API key by ID.

parameters.title: Api Key Unique ID
parameters.name: api_key_unique_id
parameters.tooltip: Specify the Unique ID of the API key.
parameters.description: Specify the Unique ID of the API key.

operations.title: Disable the API key
operations.description: Disable an API key.

parameters.title: Api Key Unique ID
parameters.name: api_key_unique_id
parameters.tooltip: Specify the Unique ID of the API key.
parameters.description: Specify the Unique ID of the API key.

operations.title: Enable the API key
operations.description: Enable an API key.

parameters.title: Api Key Unique ID
parameters.name: api_key_unique_id
parameters.tooltip: Specify the Unique ID of the API key.
parameters.description: Specify the Unique ID of the API key.

operations.title: List Service IDs By Name
operations.description: Returns a list of service IDs. Users can manage user API keys for themself, or service ID API keys for service IDs they have access.

parameters.title: Account ID
parameters.name: account_id
parameters.description: Specify Account ID of the service ID(s) to query.
parameters.tooltip: Specify Account ID of the service ID(s) to query.

parameters.title: Name
parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Specify name of the service ID(s) to query. Optional.20 items per page.
parameters.tooltip: Specify name of the service ID(s) to query. Optional.20 items per page.

parameters.title: Page Size
parameters.name: pagesize
parameters.placeholder: eg: Default is 20 items per page.
parameters.description: Optional size of a single page. Default is 20 items per page. Valid range is 1 to 100.
parameters.tooltip: Optional size of a single page. Default is 20 items per page. Valid range is 1 to 100.

parameters.title: Page Token
parameters.name: pagetoken
parameters.placeholder: eg: Default is start with first page.
parameters.description: Optional Prev or Next page token returned from a previous query execution. Default is start with first page.
parameters.tooltip: Optional Prev or Next page token returned from a previous query execution. Default is start with first page.

parameters.title: Sort
parameters.name: sort
parameters.tooltip: Optional parameter to filter the type of the queried API keys. Can be 'user' or 'serviceid'.
parameters.description: Optional parameter to filter the type of the queried API keys. Can be 'user' or 'serviceid'.

parameters.title: Order
parameters.name: order
parameters.tooltip: Optional sort order, valid values are asc and desc. Default: asc.
parameters.description: Optional sort order, valid values are asc and desc. Default: asc.

parameters.title: Include History
parameters.name: include_history
parameters.tooltip: Defines if the entity history is included in the response.
parameters.description: Defines if the entity history is included in the response.

operations.title: List Service IDs By Account ID
operations.description: Returns a list of service IDs. Users can manage user API keys for themself, or service ID API keys for service IDs they have access.

parameters.title: Account ID
parameters.name: account_id
parameters.description: Specify Account ID of the service ID(s) to query.
parameters.tooltip: Specify Account ID of the service ID(s) to query.

operations.title: Create A Service ID
operations.description: Creates a service ID for an IBM Cloud account. Users can manage user API keys for themself, or service ID API keys for service IDs.

parameters.title: Account ID
parameters.name: account_id
parameters.description: Specify Account ID of the service ID(s) to query.
parameters.tooltip: Specify Account ID of the service ID(s) to query.

parameters.title: Name
parameters.name: name
parameters.tooltip: Name of the service id.
parameters.description: Specify the name is not checked for uniqueness. Therefore multiple names with the same value can exist. Access is done via the UUID of the API key.
parameters.placeholder: e.g: Name of the service id.

parameters.title: Description
parameters.name: description
parameters.description: Optional description of the service ID to update. If specified an empty description will clear the description of the service ID. If an non empty value is provided the service ID will be updated.
parameters.tooltip: Optional description of the service ID to update. If specified an empty description will clear the description of the service ID. If an non empty value is provided the service ID will be updated.

parameters.title: Unique Instance CRNs
parameters.name: unique_instance_crns
parameters.tooltip: Optional CRNs which point to the services connected to this service ID.
parameters.description: Optional CRNs which point to the services connected to this service ID.

operations.title: Update Service ID
operations.description: Updates properties of a service ID.

parameters.title: Service ID
parameters.name: service_id
parameters.tooltip: Unique ID of the service ID to be updated.
parameters.description: Unique ID of the service ID to be updated.

parameters.title: Name
parameters.name: name
parameters.tooltip: Name of the service id.
parameters.description: Specify the name is not checked for uniqueness. Therefore multiple names with the same value can exist. Access is done via the UUID of the API key.
parameters.placeholder: e.g: Name of the service id.

parameters.title: Description
parameters.name: description
parameters.description: Optional description of the service ID to update. If specified an empty description will clear the description of the service ID. If an non empty value is provided the service ID will be updated.
parameters.tooltip: Optional description of the service ID to update. If specified an empty description will clear the description of the service ID. If an non empty value is provided the service ID will be updated.

parameters.title: Unique Instance CRNs
parameters.name: unique_instance_crns
parameters.tooltip: Optional CRNs which point to the services connected to this service ID.
parameters.description: Optional CRNs which point to the services connected to this service ID.

parameters.title: Entity Tag
parameters.name: entity_tag
parameters.tooltip: Specify the version that you retrieved when reading the service ID.
parameters.description: Specify the version that you retrieved when reading the service ID.

operations.title: Delete Service ID and Associated API keys
operations.description: Deletes a service ID and all API keys associated to it. Before deleting the service ID, all associated API keys are deleted.

parameters.title: Service ID
parameters.name: service_id
parameters.tooltip: Unique ID of the service ID to be updated.
parameters.description: Unique ID of the service ID to be updated.

operations.title: Lock The Service ID
operations.description: Locks a service ID by ID. Users can manage user API keys for themself, or service ID API keys for service IDs

parameters.title: Service ID
parameters.name: service_id
parameters.tooltip: Unique ID of the service ID to be updated.
parameters.description: Unique ID of the service ID to be updated.

operations.title: Unlock The Service ID
operations.description: Unlocks a service ID by ID. Users can manage user API keys for themself, or service ID API keys for service IDs

parameters.title: Service ID
parameters.name: service_id
parameters.tooltip: Unique ID of the service ID to be updated.
parameters.description: Unique ID of the service ID to be updated.

operations.title: Get Account Configurations
operations.description: Returns the details of an account's configuration.

parameters.title: Account ID
parameters.name: account_id
parameters.description: Specify Account ID of the service ID(s) to query.
parameters.tooltip: Specify Account ID of the service ID(s) to query.

operations.title: Update Account Configurations
operations.description: Allows a user to configure settings on their account with regards to MFA, MFA excemption list, session lifetimes, access control for creating new identities, and enforcing IP restrictions on token creation.

parameters.title: Entity Tag
parameters.name: entity_tag
parameters.tooltip: Specify the version that you retrieved when reading the API key.
parameters.description: Specify the version that you retrieved when reading the API key.

parameters.title: Account ID
parameters.name: account_id
parameters.description: Specify Account ID of the service ID(s) to query.
parameters.tooltip: Specify Account ID of the service ID(s) to query.

parameters.title: Restrict Create Service ID
parameters.name: restrict_create_service_id
parameters.tooltip: Select the action to take when service id is leaked, valid values are 'RESTRICTED', 'NOT_RESTRICTED' and 'NOT_SET'.
parameters.description: Select the action to take when service id is leaked, valid values are 'RESTRICTED', 'NOT_RESTRICTED' and 'NOT_SET'.

parameters.title: Restrict Create Platform Api key
parameters.name: restrict_create_platform_apikey
parameters.tooltip: Select the action to take when  API keys is leaked, valid values are 'RESTRICTED', 'NOT_RESTRICTED' and 'NOT_SET'.
parameters.description: Select the action to take when  API keys is leaked, valid values are 'RESTRICTED', 'NOT_RESTRICTED' and 'NOT_SET'.

parameters.title: Allowed IP Addresses
parameters.name: allowed_ip_addresses
parameters.tooltip: Defines the IP addresses and subnets from which IAM tokens can be created for the account.
parameters.description: Defines the IP addresses and subnets from which IAM tokens can be created for the account.

parameters.title: MFA
parameters.name: mfa
parameters.tooltip: Select the action to mfa trait for the account valid values are 'NONE', 'NONE_NO_ROPC', 'TOTP, 'TOTP4ALL','LEVEL1', 'LEVEL2', 'LEVEL3
parameters.description: Select the action to mfa trait for the account valid values are 'NONE', 'NONE_NO_ROPC', 'TOTP, 'TOTP4ALL','LEVEL1', 'LEVEL2', 'LEVEL3

parameters.title: User MFA
parameters.name: user_mfa
parameters.tooltip: Defines users that are exempted from the MFA requirement of the account.
parameters.description: Defines users that are exempted from the MFA requirement of the account.

parameters.title: Session Expiration In Seconds
parameters.name: session_expiration_in_seconds
parameters.placeholder: eg : Any whole number between between '900' and '86400' Default: NOT_SET
parameters.tooltip: Defines the session expiration in seconds for the account.
parameters.description: Defines the session expiration in seconds for the account.

parameters.title: Session Invalidation In Seconds
parameters.name: session_invalidation_in_seconds
parameters.placeholder: eg : Any whole number between '900' and '7200' Default: NOT_SET
parameters.tooltip: Defines the period of time in seconds in which a session will be invalidated due to inactivity.
parameters.description: Defines the period of time in seconds in which a session will be invalidated due to inactivity.

parameters.title: Max Sessions Per Identity
parameters.name: max_sessions_per_identity
parameters.placeholder: eg : Any whole number greater than 0 Default: NOT_SET
parameters.tooltip: Defines the max allowed sessions per identity required by the account.
parameters.description: Defines the max allowed sessions per identity required by the account.

parameters.title: System Access Token Expiration In Seconds
parameters.name: system_access_token_expiration_in_seconds
parameters.placeholder: eg :Any whole number between '900' and '3600' Default: NOT_SET
parameters.tooltip: Defines the access token expiration in seconds.
parameters.description: Defines the access token expiration in seconds.

parameters.title: System Refresh Token Expiration In Seconds
parameters.name: system_refresh_token_expiration_in_seconds.
parameters.placeholder: Any whole number between '900' and '259200' Default: NOT_SET
parameters.tooltip: Defines the refresh token expiration in seconds.
parameters.description: Defines the refresh token expiration in seconds.

operations.title: Trigger Activity Report For The Account
operations.description: Trigger activity report for the account by specifying the account ID. It can take a few minutes to generate the report for retrieval.

parameters.title: Account ID
parameters.name: account_id
parameters.description: Specify Account ID of the service ID(s) to query.
parameters.tooltip: Specify Account ID of the service ID(s) to query.

parameters.title: Type
parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Optional the supported value is 'inactive'. List all identities that have not authenticated within the time indicated by duration.
parameters.tooltip: Optional the supported value is 'inactive'. List all identities that have not authenticated within the time indicated by duration.

parameters.title: Duration
parameters.name: duration
parameters.description: Optional duration of the report. The supported unit of duration is hours.
parameters.tooltip: Optional duration of the report. The supported unit of duration is hours.

operations.title: Get Activity Report For The Account
operations.description: Get activity report for the account by specifying the account ID and the reference that is generated by triggering the report. Reports older than a day are deleted when generating a new report.

parameters.title: Account ID
parameters.name: account_id
parameters.description: Specify Account ID of the service ID(s) to query.
parameters.tooltip: Specify Account ID of the service ID(s) to query.

parameters.title: Reference
parameters.name: reference
parameters.description: Specify reference for the report to be generated, You can use 'latest' to get the latest report for the given account.
parameters.tooltip: Specify reference for the report to be generated, You can use 'latest' to get the latest report for the given account.
